intro: Galium musciforme, commonly known as creeping woodrys, is a low-growing herbaceous plant native to North America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its prostrate or ascending stems that often root at the nodes. The plant produces small, white or pale green flowers in clusters, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are opposite, ovate to elliptic, and often covered with fine hairs. Galium musciforme thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
